instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the developed algorithms in the related study on proximal remote sensing for monitoring water quality in inland waters, and how far can this metric go?

The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the developed algorithms for water quality monitoring is the coefficient of determination (R-2). The R-2 values obtained for the developed algorithms were 0.84 for total nitrogen (TN), 0.93 for total phosphorus (TP), and 0.91 for chemical oxygen demand (COD). These values indicate a strong correlation between the predicted values and the actual values of the water quality parameters.

In terms of how far this metric can go, the R-2 value ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 indicating a perfect fit between the predicted and actual values. Therefore, an R-2 value of 1 would represent the highest level of accuracy achievable. In the related study, the R-2 values obtained for TN, TP, and COD were all above 0.84, indicating a good level of accuracy for the developed algorithms.
